@Mrwhosetheboss  I wanted to share my recent experiences with my S24 Ultra. My relation with the Samsung Galaxy series is that my first phone was a galaxy s2, upgraded to s5 when that one came out, s10 plus and now the s24 Ultra. To be fair, I never experienced something like this and it's truly disappointing that a company like Samsung asks 1500 euro for a phone that doesn't provide the service of a good working NFC and signal. I've read many stories having the same issues which you can find within the Samsung community form. The only solution they mention is to reboot your phone everytime it happens. Sorry, not sorry, this isn't a solution to a major problem. And I also don't think this can be fixed with updates, but is more of an internal phone problem.  SOOO lets go to the beginning: 2 weeks after my purchase I've been encountering frustrating signal loss problems with my S24u. It's especially irritating when I needed my phone for important calls or browsing on the go. I had to reboot my phone to make it work again, which isn't something I expect a new phone to do.  Another headache I've been facing is with the NFC contactless payment. It's just not cooperating as it should. I've checked settings, made sure NFC is enabled, but still no luck. Like the signal loss problem, I have to reboot my phone. This is especially frustrating when you're at the cash register in the store trying to pay.  My suggestion: don't buy the phone. I truly regret not buying the Iphone now and I can't turn it back anymore, it's too late for me now. I never had these problems with the s2, s5 and s10 plus. With these issues on the s24 Ultra, it just put a dent into the reliability of Samsung's hardware and my trust into the company. I'm truly sad because I always expect the best, however.. this one isn't.  I know people will convince me to wait for updates, but I think you might also experience the same problem and reducing cognitive dissonance on your purchase..

I just don't understand the arguments of judging a large portion of a phone by it's design alone and not factor in the fact that almost everyone uses cases because the devices cost almost the price of some used cars. If you are using your phone without a case or screen protector you are such a small percentage of the population. Samsung switched back to the flat screens because they realized people were leaving because of the curved screen, people are just going to throw it in a case and flat just works better with cases and glass screen protectors. You can't sit here and argue that the curve is superior because it's literally not in all cases except for sharp corners without a case and even then the design could be altered to make that not matter at all. On curved the screen protectors are garbage, the case protection geometry is garbage and you lose workable on screen real estate. With that said case design is important but not nearly as important as symmetry and practical usability. If they would of realized that almost 10 years ago they would be way ahead of the game right now but I'm glad they are finally turning around. About time!

Camera and Hitting issue   I would like to bring to your attention a related issue that I encountered with my recently received Galaxy S24 Ultra, which I purchased from a Samsung store on January 30th.   When using the device, I have noticed a significant image shift problem when switching between zoom lenses (3x, 5x etc.) in auto mode. Also, I have noticed a barn door type transition in the camera viewfinder when switching to 3x and 5x lenses. Despite my attempts to replicate the problem in Samsung Store devices, I was unable to do so. This leads me to believe that the problem lies with the hardware of my device indicating a possible malfunction. I'm not sure this is something that can be fixed via software update.   This phone is getting very hot within 5 to 10 minutes, I want to request Samsung to provide me a new phone as soon as possible otherwise I will file a consumer court case. Despite purchasing such an expensive phone, why should I repair this phone?   As a loyal Samsung user for an extended period, I'm disappointed that such a quality concern exists in a flagship device. I have high expectations from the performance and reliability of Samsung products. And this issue falls short of those expectations.    Attention to this matter and look forward to a speedy resolution.

Let me try here, guys. I really hope I prevent someone from having bad times with this brand. What happened is I asked a friend of mine who was going to fly from Dubai to my country, Kyrgyzstan. I asked him to buy for me s23 ultra 1tb on noon or Amazon in the UAE, because it was cheaper there. He, thinking when you spend 4000 aed(1100$), better pay little extra and buy it in an official store. So without informing me he got the phone for 1336$ in an of brand store. After 2 days from the date of purchase he flew to Bishkek, our capital. I met him after a day and got my phone. 2 days past after that and I opened my phone. Another 2 days past before I started to use it as my main mobile phone. My happiness didn't last long. I discovered that many times I take my phone in my hands to use it I have to use password instead of finger print scanner. I came to know that first time to unblock your device after restart is to use password not the finger print scanner. I noticed that it was restarting. By itself. Several times per hour I came across later after checking it properly, closer. So disappointed I sent it back to Dubai hoping that they will give me a new properly working device. I was wrong. They said since it was more than a week from the date of it's purchase, they can only fix. On, no problem. If it is the policy they didn't inform us when selling. They fixed, sent my phone back to me. Now it is switching off by itself. I have a type of job where I get a lot of phone calls and messages. I mainly work with my phone. So I noticed that suddenly there is no phone calls or nor messages. I take out my phone, and it is off. I switched it on. Seems alright. But when it happens several times a day, it is not alright. I sent it back to Dubai again, for the second time. They want to fix it again. Guys, I don't want a phone which costs 1336$ to be fixed over and over again. I want a new properly working phone which doesn't require fixing Several times or I want my money back. That is what I want but not what I get from Samsunggulf. Let's what happens this time. I will update you on this matter.  By the way, we were offered to "upgrade" to from s23 ultra 1tb to s24+ 512gb by paying extra 1000 aed(274$). Nice offer! Take care everybody! Peace!

I think the reason they are not saying stuff like "The glass is 4x more scratch resistant than the iPhone 15" are national laws. In germany for example, you are not allowed to advertise your goods while saying it's better than "Brand A" or "Brand B". You can, however, advertise it as "4x more scratch resistand than the competition", as you are not making specific brands look bad on purpose. I assume, even if they would only do that on advertisements outside of germany, it could somehow end up in a lawsuit for them. Also, I don't know if other countries have a law like that. It's just "easier" to create one advertisement and change the language instead of creating multiple different advertisements for multiple countries.   Also, in the age of internet, it's clear that if Samsung advertises their glass 4x stronger than an iPhone in the UK, people outside of the UK would still pick it up and well... it wouldn't end up good I guess.
My note 20 Ultra is terrible at voice recognition
My LG V60 is still the best speech recognition

The Samsung S24's 90 degree sharp frame corners will result in when the phone is dropped on one of those four corners do to friction is going to dig in to the floor, create a dead stop instead of sliding away dissipating momentum resulting in the momentum transferring immediately on sudden stop all the kinetic energy stored up magnified to the S24 phones fragile glass frame corner on floor impact. Result.....constant cracked screens to replace. Basic physics, energy + design flaw + sudden stop + fragile glass material = broken glass, or at least gouged out metal frame corners after a few inevitable drops now with sharp metal shareds to dig into / cut / wear on your palm's skin even more uncomfortable than when a 90 degree corner leaves an uncomfortable to hold flesh dent imprint.

üéØ Key Takeaways for quick navigation:  00:00 üì± *New Samsung Galaxy s24 Ultra Design* - Updated design with flatter and less rounded elements. - New satin finish for better fingerprint resistance. - Matte textured side rails and new color options. 01:09 üõ†Ô∏è *Hardware Upgrades and Design Comparison* - Shift from aluminum to Titanium frame for strength and heat conductivity. - Introduction of a flat display for the first time since 2015. - Notable comparison to iPhone 15 Pro's design similarities. 03:15 üîÑ *Hardware Upgrades: RAM, Speaker, Wi-Fi, and Display* - Increase in RAM from 8 to 12 GB. - Redesigned internal speaker funnel for improved audio clarity. - Support for Wi-Fi 7, with up to four times faster speed than Wi-Fi 6E. 03:54 üì± *Display Enhancements: Brightness, Glass, and Gorilla Glass Armor* - 12% increase in screen responsiveness. - Significant brightness boost to 2600 nits. - Upgrade to Gorilla Glass Armor for enhanced scratch resistance and reduced screen glare. 05:20 üöÄ *Powerful Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 Chip* - Introduction of Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chip for peak performance. - Custom version for Galaxy with even faster speeds. - Focus on controlling temperatures and improving battery life. 06:30 üß† *Introduction to Galaxy AI and AI-Powered Features* - Samsung's emphasis on the role of AI in the new flagship phone. - Mention of AI cores in the chipset for on-device language models. - Teasing AI-related features beyond cameras. 07:11 üì∑ *Camera Updates: 200MP Main Camera and Pro Visual Engine* - Refreshed 200MP main camera with faster photo capture. - Introduction of the Pro Visual Engine for improved color accuracy and smoothness. - Better noise reduction algorithms for both front and rear cameras. 08:34 üé• *Camera Innovations: 4K 120fps, 5x Zoom, and Video Capabilities* - Ability to record 4K and 120fps simultaneously. - Replacement of 10x zoom lens with a more versatile 5x zoom lens. - Introduction of improved capabilities for zoomed-in video recording. 11:22 üì± *Software Updates: One UI 6.1 and Software Aesthetics* - Introduction of One UI 6.1 based on Android 14. - Redesigned drop-down menu, dynamic widgets, and jazzier aesthetics. - Positive remarks on Samsung's software direction and support. 12:19 üß† *AI Features Overview: Generative Wallpaper, Image Editing, Voice Meeting App* - Generative wallpaper allowing customization of continuous unique images. - AI image editing capabilities for instant effects and generative editing. - Introduction of an upgraded voice meeting app with AI-driven features. 13:15 üì∏ *AI Image Editing: Instant Effects and Generative AI Editor* - Instant effects for quick photo enhancements with one tap. - Generative AI editor for moving subjects, erasing distractions, and more. - Acknowledgment of being a polished and accessible entry into AI editing. 14:37 üó£Ô∏è *AI Voice Meeting App: Recording, Transcription, and Summarization* - Voice meeting app's ability to identify speakers for up to 20 people. - Mixed performance in transcription accuracy, with room for improvement. - Highlighting the impressive capability of summarizing meetings and translating them. 15:49 üåê *General Impressions on AI Features* - Varied impressions on AI features, from instant slow-mo to generative wallpaper. - Recognition of both strengths and areas for improvement in AI-related functionalities. - Overall positive outlook on the integration of AI in the flagship phone. 16:03 üìù *Notes App Organization* - The notes app can now use AI to organize documents with headers, subheaders, and bullet points. - AI can summarize points and add an automatic cover page for easy navigation. - Magic at your fingertips with AI-driven document organization, scoring 9 out of 10. 16:59 üåê *Live Translation Feature* - Live translation feature allows seamless communication across language barriers. - Real-time translation with the option to mute and hear translated portions only. - Phone's understanding of spoken language needs improvement, currently rating at 5 out of 10. 18:10 üîç *Circle to Search Feature* - Circle to search feature lets you highlight and Google any specific object. - Useful for situations where articulating into words might be challenging. - Implemented well, scoring 8 out of 10 for its simplicity and practicality. 18:52 ‚å®Ô∏è *Smart Keyboard with Chat Assist* - Smart keyboard includes chat assist for translation, writing style, and grammar checks. - Writing style suggestions provide different tones, aiming to enhance conversational typing. - Overall, powerful features for communication and writing, scoring 8 out of 10. 20:18 üåê *Integration of AI into Existing Apps* - Samsung seamlessly integrates AI features into existing apps, enhancing user experience. - Weaved AI features into everyday apps reduce friction and make tasks quicker. - Consideration for on-device AI tasks for speed, reliability, and data safety, receiving a pass. 21:57 üöÄ *Overall Assessment* - Solid hardware upgrade, flexible and fun software, and exciting prospects with AI integration. - AI features are about 50% on-device, addressing regions globally on day one. - Initial assessment is positive, recognizing the rough edges but acknowledging a good start, especially in weaving AI into the phone effectively.

@1:35 It is indeed not better at conducting heat, Titanium is 12 times worse than Aluminium in conducting heat.   You Sir, is misinformed. Aluminium has a thermal conductivity of 210 W/m-K, Titanium is only 17.0 W/m-K. Look it up. There is a reason Titanium is never used as a heat sink, simply because it does not conduct heat. It might even be one of the worst materials to surround a phone in history, the second fact is, it scratches a lot easier than Aluminium.

Well performing AI tasks on device is not as easy as is it seems.  The trend in tech for massive data processing with ML and AI nowadays is highly dependant on cloud technologies.  I mean we are moving away from having our local devices (like computers which are way more powerful) process  the stuff for us, so we let the cloud computing power handle the workload instead.  So I guess the need is to improve security protocols and confidentiality instead of processing stuff locally. That would be a stepback definitely.

My little Sony phone has had 4K 120 for years now sadly even on the newer versions of the phone they put it on the most useless camera the wide-angle camera when I need it on the zoom camera.  The real magic of cameras on smartphones is going to come when 8K cameras can record video even if only 10 or 15 seconds at a high enough bit rate so that individual 33 megapixel frames are actual usable photographs that will basically end of the point and shoot camera  Because at that point you'll be able to simply record a few seconds of video and then pick out the frame you want  Right now that doesn't really work because the individual frames are pretty low quality compared to a picture of similar resolution  Understandably so the memory buffer you would need to record that much high quality data would be pretty impressive.

Always apple..........‚ù§
Understanding the context of the conversation is the problem  Google has been doing this for over a year now and it's driving me absolutely crazy I hate it I hate it with such a passion it makes me livid I want to find the Google engineer who is implementing this and just keep whopping them on the back of the head until he stops  Google's speech to text used to be utterly amazing it would catch almost every single word I said almost without fail it was like magic  And then they started changing it I've actually gotten into heated arguments with people online accusing me of saying things I didn't say and then I realized my text did say it even though I never said it  I realized that the speech to text engine was altering what I said and sometimes in a very bad way sometimes completely inverting the meaning of what I'm saying for example replacing now with not as just one simple example  And it's not a speech recognition problem because I have seen the engine put the correct words I say on my screen and then watched it change those words to something else  My best guess is that they are trying to do exactly what you are suggesting here they're trying to use context they're trying to make the speech engine more intelligent they're trying to get it to figure out what it thinks you were trying to say while I just wanted to put down what I said no exceptions  It gets particularly bad when you start using uncommon words such as Squirtle which oddly enough Google correctly interpreted this time  I wish there was a way to turn that off to have a literal speech to text and not a contextual speech to text  I noticed it has a particular problem with I'm not sure what you call them? I call them connecting words? Where it's like in the and or etc especially in and and for some reason Google likes flipping those I'll say and and it'll put down the word in instead  It's also annoying because you can make me look like an illiterate moron where sometimes I'll read back my text and be like what the hell was I trying to say what the hell did it hear because it mangled it so bad  And the problem is it creates a huge pause in the ability to use speech to text because I proofread in real time I look at the words as it puts them on the screen and the problem is after I've moved one or two words past the current word it then changes that word to something else to match whatever it's stupid contextual engine thinks I said but I've already seen it put the word I actually said and I've moved on so I don't see that change  It's extremely annoying and extremely aggravating and I really wish they'd give us the ability to turn it the hell off.

10x is optical zoom in S23 Ultra.  10x is digital zoom in S24 ultra.  Optical is always lossless because the zooming in would be keeping "every small/intricate detail of subject in focus".  Digital zoom on the other hand would rely on the best quality captured by 50MP at 5x optical and upscale it to 10x digital hoping to capture "ALL optical lossless intricate details" just like 10x optical.  Since AI is there, the quality of shots should be comparable or better.  However, whether "those intricate details are captured" by this upscaled image remains to be seen.
Hallelujah!!  Did you really mean for viewers to join you in expressing gratitude for God's blessings and deliverance; or declaring His righteousness and victory; or to join you in praising Him?  This is what Praise the Lord means. If you are going to you a phrase you should use it correctly and not as (what you might intend as) humor.  Religious exhortations are intended as reverence for God and not as replacements for ‚Äúcool,‚Äù or ‚Äúgreat,‚Äù and certainly not for ‚Äúawesome,‚Äù as only God is awesome.

‚úì I believe we are meant to be like Jesus in our hearts and not in our flesh. But be careful of AI, for it knows only things of the flesh such as our fleshly desires and cannot comprehend things of the Spirit such as true love and eternal joy that comes from obeying God's Word [Galatians 5:16-26]. Man is a spirit and has a soul but lives in a body which is flesh. When you go to bed it is the flesh that sleeps, but your spirit never sleeps and that is why you have dreams, unless you have died in peace physically. More so, true love that endures and last is a thing of the heart. When I say 'heart', I mean 'spirit'. But fake love, pretentious love, love with expectations, love for classic reasons, love for material reasons (love because of material needs) and love for selfish reasons those are things of the flesh. In the beginning God said let us make man in our own image, according to our likeness. Take note, God is Spirit and God is Love. As Love He is the source of it. We also know that God is Omnipotent, for He creates out of nothing and He has no beginning and has no end. That means, our love is but a shadow of God's Love. True love looks around to see who is in need of your help, your smile, your possessions, your money, your strength, your quality time. Love forgives and forgets. Love wants for others what it wants for itself. However, true love works in conjunction with other spiritual forces such as patience and faith - in the finished work of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, rather than in what man has done such as science, technology and organizations which won't last forever. To avoid sin and error which leads to the death of your body and your spirit-soul in hell fire (second death), you must make God's Word the standard for your life, not AI. If not, God will let you face AI on your own (with your own strength) and it will cast the truth down to the ground, it will be the cause of so much destruction like never seen before, it will deceive many and take many captive in order to enslave them into worshipping it and abiding in lawlessness. We can only destroy ourselves but with God all things are possible. God knows us better because He is our Creater and He knows our beginning and our end. The prove texts can be found in the book of John 5:31-44, 2 Thessalonians 2:1-12, Daniel 2, Daniel 7-9, Revelation 13-15, Matthew 24-25 and Luke 21.  *HOW TO MAKE GOD'S WORD THE STANDARD FOR YOUR LIFE?* You must read your Bible slowly, attentively and repeatedly, having this in mind that Christianity is not a religion but a Love relationship. It is measured by the love you have for God and the love you have for your neighbor. Matthew 5:13 says, "You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt loses its flavor, how shall it be seasoned? It is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by men." Our spirits can only be purified while in the body (while on earth) but after death anything unpurified (unclean) cannot enter Heaven Gates. Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God [Matthew 5:8]. No one in his right mind can risk or even bare to put anything rotten into his body nor put the rotten thing closer to the those which are not rotten. Sin makes the heart unclean but you can ask God to forgive you, to save your soul, to cleanse you of your sin, to purify your heart by the blood of His Son, our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ which He shed here on earth because Isaiah 53:5 says, "But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed". Meditation in the Word of God is a visit to God because God is in His Word. We know God through His Word because the Word He speaks represent His heart's desires. Meditation is a thing of the heart, not a thing of the mind. Thinking is lower level while meditation is upper level. You think of your problems, your troubles but inorder to meditate, you must let go of your own will, your own desires, your own ways and let the Word you read prevail over thinking process by thinking of it more and more, until the Word gets into your blood and gains supremacy over you. That is when meditation comes - naturally without forcing yourself, turning the Word over and over in your heart. You can be having a conversation with someone while meditating in your heart - saying 'Thank you, Jesus...' over and over in your heart. But it is hard to meditate when you haven't let go of offence and past hurts. Your pain of the past, leave it for God, don't worry yourself, Jesus is alive, you can face tomorrow, He understands what you are passing through today. Begin to meditate on this prayer day and night (in all that you do), "Lord take more of me and give me more of you. Give me more of your holiness, faithfulness, obedience, self-control, purity, humility, love, goodness, kindness, joy, patience, forgiveness, wisdom, understanding, calmness, perseverance... Make me a channel of shinning light where there is darkness, a channel of pardon where there is injury, a channel of love where there is hatred, a channel of humility where there is pride..." The Word of God becomes a part of us by meditation, not by saying words but spirit prayer (prayer from the heart). Take note, God is Spirit and those who worship Him should do so in spirit and truth (genuinely by living the Word). When the Word becomes a part of you, it will by its very nature influence your conduct and behavior. Your bad habits, you will no longer have the urge to do them. You will think differently, dream differently, act differently and talk differently - if something does not qualify for meditation, it does not qualify for conversation.   *THE BATTLE BETWEEN LIGHT AND DARKNESS (GOOD AND EVIL)* Heaven is God's throne and the dwelling place for God's angels and the saints. Hell was meant for the devil (satan) and the fallen angels. Those who torture the souls in hell are demons (unclean spirits). Man's spirit is a free moral agent. You can either yield yourself to God or to the devil because God has given us discretion. If one thinks he possesses only his own spirit, he is lying to himself and he is already in the dark. God is light while the devil is darkness. Light (Holy Spirit) and darkness (evil spirit) cannot stay together in a man's body. God is Love (Love is light) and where there is no love is hell, just as where there is no light is darkness. The one you yield yourself to, you will get his reward. The reward of righteousness to man's spirit is life (abundant life) and the reward of sin to man's spirit is death. Sin and satan are one and the same. Whatever sin can cause, satan also can cause. Sin is what gives the devil dominion or power over man's spirit. When God's Word becomes a part of you, sin power over you is broken, you become the righteousness of God through Christ Jesus. Where Jesus is, you are and when He went (to the Father), you went. one reason why summative ai and generative ai are not running locally on the device is that their models are really big and running them with good enough speed requires top of the line x64 cpus and expensive gpus. even though snapdragon 8 gen 3 is quite powerful, an arm processor is not powerful enough to run these crazy large models offline.

Local LLMs are huge.  They're the next Smartphone and the next Internet.  At work I'm hamstringed into not using them, but at home I code so much faster with them.  I can build stuff fast I don't know enough about, random things like "Combine these WAVs into a MP3 in memory" - It's something I never needed before yesterday, but I had it up and running in minutes.  Absolutely bonkers.  By the way, dear reader, y'all can do that for free on your own hardware.  For LLMs, a good small one will be Mistral (And its many variants, but the Mistral Chat model will do great for most of you).  For Speech to Text, with or without translation, use the Whisper model.  Ask ChatGPT on how to get those to run and enjoy!  If you have better hardware, then go with Mixtral and be ready to have your mind blown.

is it worth an upgrade from a54
The more the titanium the bigger of a problem is.  Insulation properties: titanium also has better insulating properties than aluminum. This means that once it heats up, it can retain that heat for longer, making it feel hotter than aluminum, which dissipates heat more rapidly. Ergo, aluminium is better AGAINST heat vs titanium which traps it if titanium is applied more.

Boasting the "scratch resistance" of a Samsung screen anywhere beyond 2020 is a joke. Had my S20 FE for over 2 years and through real usage scenarios, It hasn't had a single scratch.   All of this phone design situation has got me thinking though, about how far 1st world problems have come worrying about the most ridiculous things like "Oh this new phone has a more curved screen whereas the previous one didn't" or "This phone has a 15% faster CPU than the last one". I am admittedly guilty of falling into this trap, But we sink so heavily into those minor changes that we don't see anything else that makes a genuine worthwhile investment. Is it so hard for a company as big as Samsung to make worthwhile, functional changes instead of bigging up the most ridiculous, microscopic ones? Bring out a phone, make sure it does it's best, and watch it roll in those numbers. The comparison between the last phone and this one is so absolutely minimum that they aren't even a selling point. Great, my phone screen is curved now and the graphics move faster. Fantastic. I don't care.

Meanwhile Apple is innovating on usb c
As an S22U owner, this does seem like quite an incremental upgrade. All the new AI/software features are cool - but just that, software implementations. So they could be in pretty much any modern smartphone. I can appreciate the achievement if the AI models are run on the phone with a dedicated AI processing chip though, so you don't get the latency and privacy concerns of online processing.   Still, it's the actual phone hardware being improved or useful hardware features being added that would get me interested in the latest release. The camera changes seem particularly unexciting. So the best they can really say is that mid-telephoto shots of 5x up to 10x will be better, but other zoom levels will only see the smallest imporvements from processing optimisation, and 10x & above will remain about the same or perhaps be even worse. If the 10x zoom is now upscaled from 5x optical, it's going to have focus very accurately to keep enough detail for a 2x crop, and there would be more risk of artefacts like glare. When you were showing some 10x shots back to back in this video I reckon the older generation (S23) looked a bit better.  I have heard that the main camera can now do the same 2x 'lossless' cropping trick like Apple's latest, and this is handy at those wider focal lengths. TBH I thought the S23 & S22U could do this already but sources I've read suggest that no, the pixel binning from the main sensor was just for reducing noise whereas now it can use it for losless cropping too. I would imagine that would look like the phone pixel binning 4:1 to reduce from 200MP down to 50MP, then doing a 2x crop taking it down to 12.5MP; the default image size for the main camera.   It would be interesting to know if it can also fill in the centre of such a cropped image with pixels from the next camera up in zoom, if it believes that will make a better image. I'm sure it's technically capable but with the 3x camera being significantly worse than the main camera I doubt this method would be used that often. It does raise the point as to why Samsung keeps in the existing 3x camera if it's the weakest of the bunch. I really would've liked to see a bigger sensor for the 3x, especially when they push it as the zoom level of choice for portraits.   The 0.5x ultra-wide would be another one that would be nice to get a better sensor. A shame that Samsung aren't pushing this forward when many of the Asian phone manufacturers are making some cool advancements with camera hardware - bigger sensors (including for ultra-wide), faster lenses, internal gimbals for excellent stabilisation, changeable physical aperture (which even Samsung had a limited version of in the past) etc.  In addition to camera hardware I think the kind of improvements that would have excited me would have been things along the lines of getting a physical camera shutter button like the Sony Xperia series, getting touch sensitive shoulder triggers like some gaming phones (ROG phone etc.). This could be useful for a lot of users - of course gaming, an area that Samsung likes to market its phones at beintg excellent at, but also for quick action buttons and for being able to control the camera with e.g. swipe left/right on a trigger to zoom in & out when the camera is open. In fact Samsung have gotten worse with hardware features like this over the years, remvoing the Bixby button that could handily be re-assigned as a one press camera launcher. And I still miss the headphone jack and micro SD card slot, so useful in certain situations!   I did think Samsung would have included an equivalent to MagSafe in the 24 series. It's innovative hardware features like this that get my attention. I know the new Qi charging standard will incorporate magnetic mounting but clearly it will be a while until it's actually incoporated into a Samsung device. I can already pop on a MagSafe case that has been designed for a Samsung phone like the Pitaka case I use on my S22U. But then you are limited to using only certain cases, and some MagSafe cases intefere with the S Pen. It would've been great if Samsung could've included magnetic mounting in the phone itself, so there would be no S Pen compatbaility worries and the ability to use whatever outer case you like - that Samsung case Arun showed that can turn the finger grip into a stand looks cool!  Personally I'm gonna skip 1 or 2 generations so I can see more improvements. Even though I could get the S24U for around ¬£600 with the trade in/introductory offers, and the fact I've filled up all the 256GB on my S22U and need to start moving things like big videos files off if I don't ugprade now (another reason to lament the removal of a microSD slot), it's still not worth it to me at that price.  To be fair though, this does show just how far we have come with smartphones and it really is incredilbe this tiny device in our pockets has more processing power than supercomputers that filled rooms in the past, can take great quality photos, and zoom at levels you would've thought a big telephoto lens would be needed for.
What's a " Rooter"?

Just by tweaking the camera and software and some of the hardware here and there, Samsung is gonna sell S24 ultra for a whopping US$ 1500-1700 or even more. I appreciate your thorough testing amd sharing, this thing looks amazing!  One thing that bothers me is that I see people describing the zoom from 5√ó to 10√ó as "digital zoom", which traditionally means that other than the image cropping, you lose the same level of detail in the resulting photo.      With the way the photos are saved, this should be called optical zoom, because the much higher resolution of the sensor still gives better than 1:1 REAL pixel clarity at a full 10√ó zoom.  No AI, nor other processing tricks are necessary here.  So the clarity should be identical to the previous 10√ó lens zoom images of the previous phones.      I noticed on my S21 Ultra, zioming from 3√ó to 10√ó gives full clarity all the way, with one caveat... Only in the centre of the image where the 10√ó image is placed on top of the 3√ó image.  The area around it doesn't gain zoom clarity as it's zoomed in.  It's so imperceptible the way they are combined unless you're looking for it.      Final thing... Did samsung drop their 240/480/960 fps REAL slow motion capture and just expect AI to fill in the gaps?  I'd still like to capture real detail if possible.

Is it worth it to upgrade from the S21 Ultra Exynos version?
The S24 brings some notable upgrades over the S23, such as some advanced AI features and an improved chipset. However, the smartphone market seems to be hitting their peak with expectable improvements like speed boosts and camera upgrades. Those who maximize their use of smartphones would definitely benefit from these updates but for many users who are likely using their phones to scroll through TikTok or to play casual games will not really benefit from these updates. There just isn't something revolutionary that could change my life from upgrading to the latest phones cause older phones such as the S10 and iPhone X already have everything we need for the majority of tasks like SNS or casual games.

1:37 Wrong! Aluminum, with a thermal conductivity of 210 W/m-K, outperforms Titanium, which has a thermal conductivity of just 17.0 W/m-K. Due to this, Aluminum is often used in applications requiring effective heat dissipation, such as heat sinks and cookware.Oct 19, 2023 For example, although titanium remains strong at high temperatures, it doesn't easily dissipate heat, which can cause heat build-up in the metal, straight from google lol

BUT STILL AN APPLE FAN BOY
While the SD 8 Gen 3 is definitely one of fastest ARM SoCs on the planet, it's still a bit disingenuous to say it's faster than the A17 Pro since neither of the two were designed for/are able to support the other's intended OS. As such, even when trying to use Geekbench as a sort of "middle ground" to benchmark the two in an equal manner, it's still not quite a 100% accurate representation seeing as both chips will always interact with apps/programs designed for their target OS differently. It will always be this way unfortunately, since Apple SoCs do not inherently support the ability to perform instructions based on anything other than iOS/iPad + Mac OS. That being said, however, I'd still argue that the SD 8 Gen 3 has the potential to outshine the A17 Pro since I'm willing to bet that any smartphone manufacturer that's planning to use it for their phones will make sure to implement a proper cooling solution so that the chip does not thermal throttle (unlike Apple and the lackluster cooling system inside the 15 Pro & 15 Pro Max...)
Provisualisation = Mrwhosetheboss cannot find algorithm tricks used on moon photos üòÄ

In 2024 they managed to finally start with $AWT88K and that was years in the making. If some of you still didnt catch that fish then maybe my words will help one or a few to actually understand why that is so powerful. Yes I know it sounds awfully like r
Here's my rant, factual style.  If some of yall feel as if I'm making a baseless fuss over something small and not important in the grand of schemes, just hear me out.  And now, let's begin   Why the hell did they go away with the curved screen?? First, it made their Ultra/Plus/Edge phones stand out in the flat-dominated phone industry for years... it was particularly unique as for as the mainstream world is concerned. You know it's a SAMSUNG, and you can't say the same about Apple and other major players. Second, it gave their phones a slicker/stealthier asesthic appearance. And finally, last but not least, despite a VERY VERY VERY small difference in screen real estate  and ergonomics, it's not worth giving it up. From experiences, I think the curve has a slight advantage over the flat ergonomically. I've had their curved phones since the very first time they introduced it on the Galaxy  S6 Edge, and I never looked back.  Obviously, they improved it over the years, and looking back imo perfected it with the Ultra phones. I've had my S22 Ultra ever since it was made available in stores, and it's in the perfect sweetspot along with the S21U and S23U. It's not too curved where the sides are too thin  and dig into your palm (looking at you S6 Edge), nor it's too flat-ish where it feels blocky and big to hold (looking at you Apple, Google, etc). Yes, the flats has  bigger screen real estate, but personally, I don't feel bothered by it because as I mentioned earlier, the difference is so small. It's so small, so why ditched the curve? The question is, why ditched something that has been a stand-out feature that was clearly working for years???
I pray to god that the circle to search feature plugs into our search engine of choice. It would be such a waste for it to be another Google search trojan horse.

So, I picked up my 23 Ultra a month after it released. That being said, I do love the improvements. The inclusion of the upgraded APU, the complete matte finish, and the flat screen. However, my s23 Ultra does what I want. I can play my childhood games (created from my own backups), I still have a good enough camera to capture what i need to, and its still keeping a great battery life. Of course the battery life isnt what it was day one but I can easily go a full day on one charge (and I am usually awake from Noon to 6AM the next day). Is this an amazing upgrade from mine? On paper, yes of course it is. Is it worth upgrading to? I can see if you need the upgrades then sure. However, I cannot convince myself to upgrade from the 23 Ultra. one thing to mention: Titanium is a pretty bad metal thermal conductor, in 3D printing the heatbreaks are made of it to decouple the hot heaterblock from the rest of the Printhead, especially to keep the upper filament as cool as possible. Aluminuim instead is the second best metal thermal conductor, as i know, also used in 3D printing, its the heaterblock, because its a great thermal conductor! and much cheaper as the best "copper" and it not as soft and does not corrode. So its probably only because titanium is more premium/prestige! the only thing where it out performs stainless steel is the weight, its only around 60% but at which cost, steel performs as heat conductor better than titanium, too. I understand that weight matters for most users, so thats definively a point, but aluminuim  alloys can be made extremely tough as well,(oldschool vapes are made out of zinc alloy) its only marketing, in my opinion! üòâ But i like your since years

I've got an S22 Ultra, and I bought it mostly because I like high-end features, even if I don't use them often (I get a kick out of the 100x zoom from time to time, using the pen to write the rare note or take a photo, etc.).  Most of these AI features I won't actually use, but I do think are critical for the future, like the auto-translate working on the default app.  Google has had live transcription and translation for years (and with offline as an option if you download the language), but it requires a separate feature to be enabled (you can add a shortcut to the bottom-corner of the screen to use it).  TBH, if I was a more social person, or posted photos more, the new AI features would be very good to have, but I'm not, so it's more of a 'This is a good thing for everyone to have access to, even if I probably won't use it much if at all' type of thing.  I'll probably get a new phone with the S25 or maybe even 26, so I'm curious how AI features will expand and improve in that time.

The Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 is actually NOT more powerful than the iPhone. The number you showed was a freeze test conducted with a reference device designed to bring out every bit of performance from the chip, compared to a regular iPhone 15 Pro in typical conditions. Compared to the score of an actual S24 Ultra, the iPhone is just over 7% faster. Simply attaching an $18 Peltier cooler to the back of that iPhone would bring the Geekbench score up to 8,400, over 10% faster than the freeze-tested 8 Gen 3 reference unit

üëçüèΩ üá¨üáß January 2024  For anyone (like me) very much interested in screen brightness, please note the following:  *1)* It's getting a bit like with LED torches - some 'peak' figure which is a nonsense for real-World use - very much akin to the 'Peak/RMS' difference in the audio world  *2)* Some of this peak capacity will be for HDR content - i.e. how bright it can make _certain spots on the screen_ - not necessarily 'screen brightness'  *3)* To the extent that the new peak brightness figure applies to the screen overall - note that this only needs to be true (√† la the torch world) for a very short period of time, just enough to allow the claim to be legal to make  *4)* In reality - it will give peak brightness until it gets to 38¬∞C (how it is on the S23 Ultra) - & will then throttle it down _a lot_ !!  So - if you live in the arctic - sure - the peak brightness might be real-World useful in sunshine - but for the rest of us - it's a marketing gimmick  This comment is for the benefit of anyone for whom peak brightness might sway their upgrade decision overall.

I can say only one thing - meh. I thought that these AI features are something great, amazing, new. But these are nothing great‚Ä¶
It is concerning the AI usage... Imagine people using the translation feature for important discussions, you need to make sure the other understand you properly. Same happens with image editing, someone editing just person position in a photo could change the whole meaning. Or the fact bullets for notes, AI is not able to understand subjects so it can skip one super important line which it did not understand...  The usage of AI is concerning because current technology has no idea of concepts. These distinction is super important, because it lacks meaning. It can not identify that Pokemon is a game with its own names, for example (very good test btw). All the AI tech available can not understand the importance of what you say or how it is used, and opens the door for concerning usage and mistakes. Companies need to stop releasing half baked AI features without proper user understanding and making clear what the AI can do and what can not do. But because they want publicity and sales, they are being really irresponsible. Who will take responsibility for a wrong translation? Who takes responsibility for malicious image editing?  Also, we need to make clear to the receiver of any text, image or audio AI generated, that he is receiving AI generated or modified content. It is not enough to make a small icon on the corner. And this is said without the whole privacy consideration...   As we facilitate the usage of AI tools, it is also important to increase public awareness and education. Yes, you can do most of these things with other available tools, but we are making these tools very easy to use and this is going to bring problems.

No, Titanium is worse at conducting heat than Aluminium by many orders. Here's a cool fact, which I think is, or should be common knowledge in watch purchasing and/or collecting: touching the surface of a watch left untouched to feel its surface temperature is is one of the key points for discerning whether it's made from real titanium, or from another material. Titanium wouldn't impart too much of a cold sensation, because it cannot accumulate or dissipate heat as quickly as a steel watch can. Therefore, Titanium should feel warmer to the touch and the cold shouldn't linger too much.  I don't know where did this false notion about Titanium arise recently. Maybe because it's now found in trendy tech gadgets that people are now more interested in it and spread false informations and half-truths about it? I wish I could tell.
fINALYY Mrwhosethboss on s24

And there‚Äôs already fakes
Being as I am a 20+ year Aircraft Structures Technician who knows a lot about metal, including steel, aluminum, titanium, magnesium etc. I can tell you that you are incorrect when you say that titanium is better at conducting heat away from the phone. Actually titanium has very high heat properties and is used as a heat shield specifically because it doesn't transfer heat well. So the heat inside the phone would actually be more contained inside a titanium skinned phone than an aluminum skinned phone. Aluminum works great as a "heat sink" because it transfers heat better than any other metal. Radiators in cars are made of aluminum for the same reason.
